org.uilib.util
Class SmartExecutor

java.lang.Object
  org.uilib.util.SmartExecutor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Executor, Throttle
public final class SmartExecutor
extends Object
implements Throttle, Executor

An Executor that provides commonly-used methods for running Runnables and is a Throttle. It uses a Scheduler-Thread to schedule and run tasks.

Method Summary
 void cancelRepeatingRunnable(Runnable runnable)
          cancel a scheduled repeating runnable

          creates a new SmartExecutor with a cached thread-pool.

 void scheduleAtFixedRate(long period, TimeUnit timeUnit, Runnable runnable)
          schedule a Runnable to be executed using a fixed delay between the end of a run and the start of the next
 void shutdown()
          shut the executor down
 void throttle(String throttleName, long delay, TimeUnit timeUnit, Runnable runnable)
          Schedules a Runnable to be executed a fixed period of time after it was scheduled If a new Runnable with the same throttleName is scheduled, it will overwrite Runnable which were scheduled before but not yet run.

create

public static SmartExecutor create()
creates a new SmartExecutor with a cached thread-pool. It has to be shutdown after use.

throttle

public void throttle(String throttleName,
                     long delay,
                     TimeUnit timeUnit,
                     Runnable runnable)
Description copied from interface: Throttle
Schedules a Runnable to be executed a fixed period of time after it was scheduled If a new Runnable with the same throttleName is scheduled, it will overwrite Runnable which were scheduled before but not yet run. This way only the last Runnable in a series will be executed.

Specified by:
throttle in interface Throttle
